snippet: The authorities in central Hunan Province determined that a veteran dissident who was found dead in his hospital room last month took his own life, a news service reported.
abstract: Authorities in China's central Hunan Province determine that Li Wangyang, labor activist who was found dead in his hospital room days after he gave interviews proclaiming his determination to continue agitating against China's authoritarian government, took his own life; critics assail the contention, questioning how he carried out the hanging given his poor health and the presence of police minders outside his room.
lead_paragraph: The authorities in central Hunan Province determined that a veteran dissident who was found dead in his hospital room last month took his own life, a news service reported.

headline.main: China Concludes That Dissident Committed Suicide
headline.print_headline: Inquiry by China Finds Dissident Killed Himself
